subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.0 IDE support
msgSnippet: ... I m an emeritus committer for Ant, and get on well with some of the head honchos. I ve volunteered on the Ant mailing list to be a conduit between these
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:
> Excellent idea. If anyone has an "inside connection" to ant,
> let me know.

I'm an emeritus committer for Ant, and get on well with some of the head
honchos. I've volunteered on the Ant mailing list to be a conduit
between these two lists, where one is needed, and to do *some* work
involved in writing a JUnit4 Ant task.

One of the things near the top of my priority list is that we don't get
into the current mess again whereby you need to add JUnit's jar file to
Ant's lib directory (or specify -lib ...) due to the JUnit task already
being part of the distribution. To be honest, I think the JUnit project
should "own" the Ant task more than Ant should. (I'm not suggesting it
should be part of the normal JUnit distribution, however.) Hopefully
licences shouldn't get in the way of using a lot of the existing JUnit
Ant task and contributing it to a JUnit-owned repository...

I suspect that a lack of first-class Ant support would be a major
contributing factor to a slow take-up of JUnit4.

As I say, I'm happy to do some of the work, but as we've seen before I'm
not always able to find time to do all I'd like to (parameterised tests
anyone? I'll get back to it some day!). This is likely to become worse
in a couple of months when we go from a family of three to a family of
five - but I'm sure I'll find *some* hacking time. In particular I'm
also happy to code review :)

Jon
